sticky.translation[0].definitions[0].def: made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces
sticky.translation[0].definitions[0].not: sticky tape/label etc British English (=tape etc that is made so it will stick to surfaces)
sticky.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: There’s some sticky stuff in your hair.
sticky.translation[0].definitions[1].def: weather that is sticky makes you feel uncomfortably hot, wet, and dirty
sticky.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: It was hot and sticky and there was nowhere to sit.
sticky.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a sticky situation, question, or problem is difficult or dangerous
sticky.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The business hit a sticky patch and lost £4.8 million.
sticky.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a website that is sticky is interesting to the people looking at it and makes them want to look at it for a long period of time
sticky.translation[1].definitions[0].def: sticky prices do not change very much and are slow to react to changing market conditions
sticky.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: In this situation, prices and wages tend to be sticky and are unresponsive to shifts in the market.
sticky.translation[1].definitions[1].def: used to describe a website that attracts people to visit it and to spend a long time on it
sticky.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: You need to build a sticky site that entertains people.
sticky.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to be likely to steal something
